program: Master of Science in Computer Science (MSCS)

sections.text: Northwestern’s MSCS provides advanced training in computing foundations and specialized areas to prepare students for technical careers or PhD study.

items: Graduate coursework across systems, AI/ML, HCI, software engineering, theory, and data management
Flexible plan of study with adviser guidance
Project or research opportunities with faculty labs
sections.text: Students tailor a graduate curriculum spanning core and advanced CS topics, with options for project-based or research experiences.

items: Bachelor’s degree in CS or related field recommended
Completion of required graduate credits and distribution per department
sections.text: Admission favors strong computing preparation; completion follows departmental credit and distribution policies.
Graduates work in software engineering, data and AI roles, product engineering, and research, or continue to doctoral programs.
